content: It's great that there is interest into it (https://github.com/rust-secure-code/wg/issues/28). Coincidentally, I was looking into it the past week but I haven't made my mind yet if we want a new tool or adapt reprotest. From what I've seen, reprotest supports all the environment we want to manipulate in Linux so a new tool would be a specialized port of it with Windows support (ideally). Anyone has an opinion about it?

awesome work /cc @snf https://twitter.com/bascule/status/1167156046642610178

The @rustlang compiler is approaching the point where a stage 3 build could potentially be a bit-for-bit identical reproduction of the stage 2 build. Amazing work :tada: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/34902#issuecomment-526318774

- Tony "ABOLISH ICE" Arcieri (@bascule)
can't wait until it's possible to prove equivalence (or non-equivalence :scream:) of the current build and one reproducibly bootstrapped from mrustc
